website_summaries.verdict: A solid and sturdy cage for small pets including rabbits. Owners may end up replacing the bedding tray for one that is a bit deeper.
pros: Easy to clean, with extra-wide doors
Sturdy shelves don’t need to be detached for cleaning, saving time
Owners like the configurability of this cage
cons: Somewhat difficult to put together – a helper, rubber mallet and elbow grease needed
Bedding tray is too shallow, letting rabbits kick debris out of cage

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cage. Use a mixing tub if you want deep litter trays.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and the doors make it so much easier to clean than my old cage. Use a cement mixing tub from Home Depot if you want a really deep cage pan. I don't know the item number, but there are only a couple, look for the one that's the same dimensions as the cage, then trim 1/2" of plastic around the rim and it fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mead

customer_reviews.title: Poorly manufactured
customer_reviews.text: We've just returned our second cage. The first one arrived with the plastic trays cracked. The replacement cage looks in better shape but it is so poorly welded it has proved to be impossible for my (very practical engineer) husband to assemble. Some bits were capable of being straightened out with a rubber mallet, but half way through assembly we got to a point where the pieces simply didn't fit together and would have needed chamfering, which we aren't prepared to do for a product that is supposed to be "no tools required". So disappointing that an expensive cage is so badly manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Muffin's mummy

customer_reviews.title: Everything is bent
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this less stars I would. I thought this would be a great cage for my rats, which it could still be a great cage if I ever get it put together. Everything is bent to hell and back, on having to pry edges and force pieces in because they dont fit from being bent. There are spots on the cage that show alot of wear like it could have been used before. I have very disappointed, the price that was paid for this cage is ridiculous for it to come beat up and scuffed everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I was on the fence, but am so glad I got it!
customer_reviews.text: My cage came today and I love it, and so do my 3 rats!! CONS: The reason I gave it four stars was that it was an absolute NIGHTMARE to put together. And two of the pieces did not fit correctly, but I figured out a way to make it work. It's also a little pricey PROS: it's much larger than I expected! I was thinking I would need to buy the add on when my babies got bigger, but this size is perfect!!! It is pricey, but 100% worth it Overall I am so happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top level is dangerous for pets!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cage and it's easy to clean, but the smaller top shelf can fall down onto the lower level. I went to say good morning to my rats and one was trapped underneath the fallen level. He wasn't moving so I thought he'd been killed. He ended up being ok, but that was really scary. The top level is just not secure enough on the little hooks for how heavy it is. Also having such shallow litter pans is ridiculous. If you buy this cage, make sure to zip tie the level on the far side, and I'm going to add some 3" plexiglass to the sides by the levels to compensate for the shallow pans.
customer_reviews.author: Jaloux

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT!! My bunnies love thier new cage. I was really worried about this coming damaged since a lot of reviews said theirs was , but not a single bar was bent. Also this was actually really easy to assemble, im 17 and i did it by myself and it took less than an hour. I would recommend this cage to anyone. (I actually have already! My friend is now considering upgrading to this cage.)
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product a zero if I could... This is a very cheaply made product. The parts were not cut very well so the holes did not line up for the installation. It took a long time to put this together because of the poor workmanship. It looked like parts of this cage had been returned by all the scratches on some of the parts. The box looked as if it had been sitting around for years, then it was thrown around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: would be a 5 star product if it wasn't so wonky & hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: this cage needs to be packed better. there's no padding between the metal grates and they're all slightly warped and scuffed from shipping. which means when you go to assemble it, nothing fits right and you have to use a rubber mallet to reshape all the pieces. and even after hours of work hammering iron bars and straining to fit the pieces together, i found that the doors on my unit are wonky and one peg doesn't reach the hole to lock in place. i'm so grumpy! i don't wanna disassemble the thing to send it back. :/ i guess we'll see if anyone escapes. for $125 the packaging and quality control should be WAY better.
customer_reviews.author: char

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this cage has such good reviews. It is nice and sturdy but with how pricey it is you would think they would give you a higher pan for it, I have to clean everyday because my Guinea pigs scatter their bedding everywhere around the cage. I feel like their bedding is more on the floor than in the cage. I even built blocks around it to prevent this from happening but my under pan is too small and stuff just goes through the bottom. My advice find a different cage, like I said it's big and sturdy but the pan along with no barriers gotta go, unless you want to clean your animals bedding everyday
customer_reviews.author: nankoda

customer_reviews.title: Multiple broken pieces - cage not functional
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed because I decided to buy a more expensive product thinking it would be less hassle but when it arrived there were so many bent, warped pieces that the cage literally could not be assembled. I had to put my new pet rats in a tiny claustrophobic hamster cage until replacement parts arrived. The multiple parts required to make the cage functional did arrive as promised and do not appear to be defective but it took an entire week. Not sure if this is a manufacturer or shipper problem but nonetheless my experience makes it difficult to recommend this product to people via amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M B

customer_reviews.title: It’s the best. Don’t waste money, go big or go home
customer_reviews.text: Huge cage. Strong bars. Bar spacing small enough for rats and sugar gliders even. I have a chinchilla, it’s perfect. You’ll have to make adjustments if you’re using it for a hedgehog since they can’t see well and will walk right off of the ledges and ramps but the large cage is worth adjusting for safety. Wheels are so convenient, makes sweeping under it easy. Easy and fast to put together. 10/10 they’re expensive but I have 8 years of critter experience and I’ve learned if you buy a smaller cheaper cage, you will end up upgrading to this anyways. Might as well save money and time by getting this from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Joci McCann

customer_reviews.title: Poop and debris fall out out, impossible to keep area clean.
customer_reviews.text: No testing was done with animals in this cage, the cleanup and maintenance is high. Everything spills out from the edges and down to the floor. You can try to add on additional walls to the cage but you will most likely fail. When shopping for a cage make sure it provides the important functions of containing animals and allowing you to clean up after them easily. Guinea pigs are a particularly poor match for this cage. We switched to a Cubes and Coroplast Cage (C&C) and are much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Fib

customer_reviews.title: Great cage, checking for shipping damage
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and ease of putting it together. Had to use a mallet on two pieces that were slightly out of shape but expected due to shipping. Well made otherwise. Only complaint is that the shelf tray arrived cracked in one corner and the front left door appears to be defective. It sits too low and won’t fit the closing peg in the door at the top therefore it won’t securely close. Noting I haven’t contacted the company yet about it. Otherwise will update review to 5 stars if this is a cage defect and I’m able to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AnthroPod

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cage that converted easily into a tabletop unit when we needed it to!
customer_reviews.text: The cage is sturdy and provides a nice environment for our two rats. Unfortunately our cat was attracted to it and was often found prowling the perimeter waiting to pounce! What worked wonders for us was that we could in fact remove it from the wheeled base and it now sits up on a table in our living room where our furry friends are more protected! We read mixed opinions about whether or not this was possible but in our case it was done in under an hour and sits perfect on our table top!
customer_reviews.author: nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Gineau Pigs
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a short time but long enough for a good summary. My two Gineau Pigs use the levels provided after getting the confidence. If they dont get the feel of the layout right away i would make sure to keep the food and water at their level with the incentive treat at the alternative level. Meanwhile the two levels are great for a cleaning rotation. The actual metal is impressive. I can endorse as sturdy above all. On wheels for further cleaning with a lower shelf for storage. The gate locks can be off balance but nothing to the point of not closing.
customer_reviews.author: Anan Silas

customer_reviews.title: Serious downgrade
customer_reviews.text: I use these cages for my disabled squirrels for the floor space, but that's about the only thing I like about them. The horizontal bars suck, the pan INSIDE the cage so they can chew it is just dumb, and now of all things they've made the ladders PLASTIC FOR RODENTS. @midwest really? Grate over the pan, vertical bars (the water bottles won't hang right with horizontal bars), and ditch the cheap, plastic, unusable ladders. People who use these cages use those plastic parts to close the hole when we stack them. The plastic piece is completely useless. The only upsides are floor space and durability, but I won't buy anymore after this.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this cage. It's definitely the best cage out there for sugar gliders. It's a great size, love the bottom storage shelf and it is solid. The only complaints I have is one of the doors doesn't line up right, and the assembly process was a little clunky, but it's doable. For the price, especially when that included shipping, it's a nice cage.
customer_reviews.author: Macallan

customer_reviews.title: The cage came out beautiful!!
customer_reviews.text: The cage came out beautiful!!! I did need to use a hammer sometimes to make things fit better but at least I know it's super secure, my bunny is super happy and has a lot of room now ! The stairs came a little bent but they're supposed to have an arch, it wasn't a big deal, I didn't even need them because I put it low enough so he could hop up. The metal and the doors are beautiful, definitely what I paid for!!!! (I'm 15 and put this cage together with the help of my 11 year old cousin, it was super simple)
customer_reviews.author: Kayla L

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cage
customer_reviews.text: We received this yesterday and it is better than I imagined. It's sturdy, doesn't seem to be tipsy, in case a naughty cat jumps on it and seems to be easy to roll around. The construction of it was a bit tricky. We couldn't find the letters that it was referencing, and so relied a lot on the pictures. After a few miss steps in the beginning and hubby thinking he knew how it went together, it's together and Lou the squirrels likes it a whole lot better than the smaller one he was in. Easy for him to go from floor to floor and the trays wipe out easy!
customer_reviews.author: Ma Hen

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good and safe cage for your a chinchilla!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Easy to clean -Spacious; multilevel and easy to customize -Can be split into two individual units -Doors are sturdy and open wide for easy handling -Good quality material -Storage space at the bottom -Can be easily disassembled Cons: -Really, really heavy -When assembling, some key and socket pieces don't very well- metal is bent or warped due to manufacturing errors. Required brute force but I can imagine some won't fit at all or would result in an unstable cage. -Cage wobbles and shakes the floor when my chinchillas run on their wheels (fixed with padding on the floor)
customer_reviews.author: tree give oxygen

customer_reviews.title: fantastic cage - works for 2 guinea pigs
customer_reviews.text: We got this cage for our new critters, and it's great. Very easy to put together and surprisingly sturdy. The bottom pan was cracked when it arrived, so we taped over it and contacted the manufacturer, which has great customer service & which sent a replacement immediately. The pigs can use the ramp (had to show one of them how to, and then she was fine), they seem to have a decent amount of room, the rack on the bottom is great for holding their supplies, and the rollers are very convenient when cleaning around the cage. We highly recommend this cage.
customer_reviews.author: azb

customer_reviews.title: Its  huge
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to us. It was pricey but friends swore by it. First off one of the pans was broken when we opened the box. Not impressive for the cost. It is also a bit time consuming to assemble but once together it appears quite sturdy. The design makes it very easy to reach into the cage which is great. A major con is that whatever bedding you put in this thing will end up everywhere. There is no significant edging to keep your little critter from throwing all of their bedding and food on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but it will last
customer_reviews.text: I have heard great things about the CN. I have 6 ferrets and before i got this i used a 7 foot, customized caged. It was a disaster. I needed something thay can be actually wiped down daily. I was looking for a huge cage but also in my price range. Most of the panels were broken but i contacted the company since it has a 2 year warranty and got it all replaced for free and i didnt have to send the broken ones back. The box was EXTREMELY heavy, i needed 2 people to help me bring it in. After reading everything, i built it in 30 minutes. It was Very easy, it has minimal screws and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Gilbreath

customer_reviews.title: Great Home For Rats!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cage a little over a month ago in order to get pet rats for our kids. We had minor difficulties getting some of the pieces to fit, but still had the whole thing assembled in about 30 minutes. It's perfect for our rats. The close together metal bars prevent any escape attempts and it's super easy to clean with plenty of room for our three rats to run, play, and sleep. Definitely a better home than previous aquarium based rodent setups that I've had. We would definitely recommend this home for rats!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Will need a mallet to reform parts
customer_reviews.text: Instructions say the parts should fit together without any extra tools. (They provide a small screwdriver for the necessary nuts and screws). However, I needed to hammer some parts straight to fit it in the slots. The plastic trays came cracked -- luckily it's covered and I got the large replacement tray for free. Gives rats lots of room to run and extra places for me to decorate. Would suggest potty-training because litter will fly everywhere without guards. You may want to build your own guards too.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great, but cheaply made and not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the critter nation as it is supposed to be the best small animal cage out there. Upon receiving, we had a broken side panel. The manufacturer promptly sent a replacement free, which was great. However, as of a month ago, we had to remove the legs because they were bending and bowing and I feared the cage would tip one day. Still functions, just harder to clean the bottom half now, which is annoying. I personally prefer the Purvue Hendrix double ferret cage better because it is way more sturdy and half the cost. Granted, it’s a little smaller and the bar spacing is large for smaller rats. All factors to consider. Still wouldn’t buy another critter nation
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived missing pieces. UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in two days but was missing pieces crucial to assembly. Sending back. Wow. This arrived the day after I sent the other back. Great cage for hedgehog. Easy to assemble, strong and perfect size. Has a shelf that can be placed anywhere in the cage. Shelf has a nice material-covered bridge up to the shelf. I love that its on wheels and can fit through standard doors. Also a nice shelf to keep your pet supplies just beneath the cage. I am so impressed, I may buy another one to stack on top.
customer_reviews.author: xinespen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cage
customer_reviews.text: My first order of this cage came completely crushed. I called Amazon customer service and they were above and beyond great. I had a replacement in 2 days. It was easy to assemble, my rats love it. I like that I can remove the trays easily to clean. As far as litter containment goes, some litter does fall out. I sweep daily, but I can live with that. You can fit lots of toys and ropes, has plenty of room for hammocks. I can fit a large rat wheel in it also. The ramp covers remove easily and wash well. I would definitely purchase this again and the price was the lowest I found. Five stars for Amazon customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Cheysie

customer_reviews.title: Fair cage for a hefty price
customer_reviews.text: This cage was the best on the market for our two rats. Overall I am happy enough with it, but for the price I ought to be in love with it... It is VERY frustrating that the trays aren't deep enough to hold any bedding. There is no depth to the trays whatsoever. Some of the pieces don't go together quite right. The doors fit a bit wonky, so part of the latch is impossible to fasten. Nothing stops it from working as we need it to, but I wish the pieces had a more true fit. The more you look at the cage, the more you realize everything is just slightly... Off. Fair cage, excessive price.
customer_reviews.author: Abby boone

customer_reviews.title: Difficult but good
customer_reviews.text: An awesome cage once put together. It’s sturdy, large enough for my four rats to run around in, and it looks nice! The only downside is it is super difficult to put together. There were metal pieces on the cage that were bent out of place that I had to use a mallet to bend back into place, then to get the pieces to fit together. I even had to hang from the cage to get the pieces together! It shouldn’t be that difficult, but in the end it was worth it for my rats.
customer_reviews.author: Emily B.

customer_reviews.title: Great cage for Ratties!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cage, we have the add-on top, with three ratties. I love the big doors, which make cleaning a breeze. It is well made and since it has wheels, I can clean under it. I only gave it four stars because the plastic pan was damaged upon arrival. Lara from customer service was great and worked hard to get me an undamaged replacement pan.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Badly damaged in shipping.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great home for rats, unfortunately ours was really bent up and the box broken. It was by luck I am good at straitening metal having done auto body work and having tools. After an hour and a half of repairing the top and one doors, it was straight enough to assemble. If I had to do it over again, I would inspect the box and reject it if there is any damage as this cage only goes together correctly if every part is perfectly straight. Keep in mind this box is very very very heavy and awkward to lift, so it is easily damaged as there is no protective foam inside.
customer_reviews.author: Nosheen

customer_reviews.title: Rusted very quickly
customer_reviews.text: The hinges of the doors rusted really quickly with cleaning (just sprayed down with water). Because of this the doors fell off. If you plan to clean doors and entire enclosure on a regular basis, it will likely rust and fall apart. We just bought this 2 months ago and already must purchase something different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but wanted something with tons of space and something easy to clean as my 12-year-old daughter will be cleaning ...
customer_reviews.text: Adore this cage. We only have 2 rats, but wanted something with tons of space and something easy to clean as my 12-year-old daughter will be cleaning their cage (her pets). The cage we had before was a Rat Manor from Petco and you couldn't clean it well at all - had to be taken apart to really clean it. This is awesome. All 4 front door open completely and you can clean it all well. You can lock the rats upstairs and clean downstairs without fear of them escaping. We also have the lower level guard that keeps their bedding from falling out onto the floor and that's awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: TiffyBen86

customer_reviews.title: Love the cage but not the plastic shelves.
customer_reviews.text: I splurged and bought the mansion for my two rats. I love it. I really researched many cages before I decided to spend the extra money and get the best. This cage is made well and yes it took a while to assemble but it is worth the sweat and tears trust me. This cage will last forever. My only complaint is the plastics shelves. They could be thicker and better quality. One of the corners already has a crack. I'm not sure if it came that way or if I did it while cleaning. I'm going to contact the company and see if they can help.
customer_reviews.author: Herekittykitty

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and very sturdy. The only reason I didn’t rate this five stars is because the shelves don’t sit properly. I believe they’re manufactured wrong. But overall they function well. The other thing I wanted to comment on was the fact that one of the sections wasn’t welded properly. I contacted the seller and they promptly sent out a replacement. They also sent out a replacement shelf but it had the same issue as the one that came in the package. See comment above. Overall though, I’m very satisfied with the workmanship and the customer service response. Too bad they couldn’t get the shelf situation taken care of. Would’ve been five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: e f

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought 2 rats for pets and needed a cage with small enough bars so they couldn't squeeze in between the bars. This cage is absolutely perfect. There are four tiers, more than anough room, and very sturdy. I love the little shelf on the bottom to keep everything off of the floor and I love how it's on wheels. The only thing I didn't like was the cloth on the ramps. My rats chewed the cloth until they were almost nothing so I took them off. If you want a reliable cage, this is the one to go for. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: sha_li_bo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this cage for about two months now and I am very pleased with it. I got it as a mouse mansion for my mouse son, and he is as happy as can be! The bars are close enough together that he cannot escape, and he has not tried to chew through the floor yet. Definitely wish the floor tray had more room for bedding- without any adjustments, I can fit maybe an inch of bedding at the bottom. It falls out occasionally when my mouse makes a ruckus, but not to the frequency or amount where it drives me crazy. I think if you did the adjustments other reviewers have recommended, you’d have a perfect cage!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: It has been amazing! We had 5 rats in it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this over 2 years ago. It has been amazing! We had 5 rats in it. Cleaning was a breeze. It was plenty of room for them to run around and play and still have multiple nesting pouches, slings, houses etc. We now have a squirrel that we rescued in it. He enjoys climbing up and down the walls. I’m looking into adding on a third level because I love this critter home so much. I’ve had multiple habitats in the past and this one is by far the best!
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Good cage but be prepared for potential difficulties with assembly
customer_reviews.text: This cage is perfect for my rats but I was very frustrated putting it together. It SHOULD be easy to assemble, just sliding the pieces into place, but i found that the pegs are often very off. My front panel had pegs about an inch too short so they would not reach the slot. We essentially had to break the piece off to put it together and use zip ties to hold it together. It's still a sturdy cage and in the end it doesn't effect anything but it was extremely frustrating to deal with. Anyway, despite that I still think this is one of the best cages out there for rats.
customer_reviews.author: Kiweedles

customer_reviews.title: Best Critter Cage Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly sturdy and LARGE habitat for my four rats. There's plenty of room, enough that I could probably add a couple of more rat babies! I purchased this one for the doors and the fact that they open wide and provide complete and easy access to the entire cage. Sooooo much easier to clean and navigate inside the cage with this design. My only complaint is there's so much room that I had to make and purchase additional hammocks and such to fill space!! Oh, and constructing the thing was a little wonky. Definitely a two-person job.
customer_reviews.author: Aleisha

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Huge, sturdy condominium for my chinchillas!!!
customer_reviews.text: This cage has got to be one of the best, if not THE BEST, cage(s) on the market! It is as tall as me, and built with very sturdy materials that were surprisingly easy to assemble. My 2 chinchillas are going to be THRILLED at the amount of space, and with the different levels to explore. The bars that enclose the entire outside of the cage are maybe 1/2 an inch apart, which means that this cage can probably be used for even smaller animals. I highly recommend this for your animals!
customer_reviews.author: Dibella

customer_reviews.title: Kitty cage
customer_reviews.text: We have a semi-feral bobtail cat that doesn’t get along with any of our other cats. She hides from everything and poops wherever she hides. Even with a litter box only a couple of feet away. We got this for her as a safe haven for her. Put it next to a window with that side uncovered and she’s happy as a clam. She now lets me pet her when I feed her and now purrs when I scratch her ears We put a medium litter box inside which she uses along with a kitty bed. And now she has started talking to us
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall an incredible deal
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible quality and size for the money. I love the rack on the bottom for storing my pet's supplies and the whole thing was easy enough to assemble. It also got here much earlier than expected which was great! The plastic shelf did come with a piece of its corner broken off but upon contacting the company they immediately sent me a new shelf free of charge and it arrived very quickly. Excellent product and excellent customer service
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for hamsters (NOT dwarf hamsters)
customer_reviews.text: Honestly such an amazing cage!!! Normal hamster cages are way to small but this is PERFECT for my hamster!!! There is plenty of room for her. The bottom pan is to shallow for a hamster but I got a cement mixing container for 12 bucks and it was an easy fix! The double door makes cleaning super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Great space
customer_reviews.text: Bought for guinea pigs, the shelf was adjustable so I was going to put the second shelf really low so the guinea pigs wouldn’t get hurt if they fell... I do wish it went lower than what it does as we can’t use the second shelf for the guineas it’s too much of a fall still but it’s great for storage and all the extra stuff we have! The bottom is still bigger and more room than the traditional cage we had... live all the storage space- all accessories stay in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Raelee

customer_reviews.title: Nice cage.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cage, I used this for 2 rats. I eventually switched to something else only because there was nothing to protect bedding from falling out of the sides, and I wasn't really liking using cloth. I would still recommend this cage though.
customer_reviews.author: Aundra-LynTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for my rats!
customer_reviews.text: My girls love their cage, and I do too! The fact that the whole front opens makes it SO EASY to clean/reorganize. I plan on getting the extension when I have more money (and more rats), but the single unit is plenty of room for my two girls :) My only suggestion would be that the plastic tray doesn’t have tall enough sides for a decent amount of substrate. I taped some cardboard to the sides to keep more bedding in the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, durable, fun cage. Two male rats.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, best cage. Very sturdy, easy assembly. But it was very heavy. I thought I was in shape until I carried this inside. Would recommend having someone help you, or be willing to pretend you’re not struggling. My two rat boys were bananas about all of the play room! Would recommend getting the tray for litter, because bedding will spill everywhere. The accessory kits for this were great too. Different product, but I recommend anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Lares

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am completely disappointed in this cage. I got the double critter nation. I put half of it together By myself now I have to take it back apart and send it back.. just to notice the huge gaps in the door. My little rats could definitely fit though that. It’s warped on both top of the door and bottom. Even one of the latches won’t even go on one of the holes.. I’m annoyed over the fact I paid 250 then get excited for my new cage to find I can’t even use it. I’m sure this could be a great cage if it wasn’t warped...
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my Californian rabbit
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and large enough for my big bunny. Able to just take out the trays. Did put a splash guard around the bottom to keep the urine from coming out around the bottom (used the plastic poster board, with holes punched and zip ties to keep it in place). Able to replace the trays easily. Make sure not to bang the trays on the ground. Also, both trays came with damaged edges in shipping. However, this did not preclude using them. Overall, very happy with it. A bit of a bear to put together, but not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this cage but the making of these are being rushed or something. Few bent places and places ring welded crooked. The company mailed another panel but it’s inconvient when I had to wait for the cage, put the cage together to have to stop cause of a production issue, then wait more days for the replacement. But the cage is great
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Settle

customer_reviews.title: Strong and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Very good cage, more than enough room for two Chinchillas. Very strong and sturdy. I gave it four stars because of damage due to packaging and shipping. There is no protective material around the parts, so every part near the edge of the box was slightly damaged. The box is heavy, and you can tell it got dragged and rolled end over end. In the end most damage was minor, but the door frames got bent, and the doors don’t close right. Had to bend them this way and that to get them to latch. They work good now that I bent them back to the right way.
customer_reviews.author: StevenM

customer_reviews.title: Best. Cage. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I also had some minor issues with some of this cage fitting together perfectly during assembly, but a few taps with a rubber mallet took care of the job. That was the bad, now on to the good. There is plenty of room for our rats to run. The doors swing open wide enough so that the trays can be easily removed for cleaning. The cage, once assembled, is rock solid, and it does assemble relatively easily. The wheels allow it to be moved around easily, even on carpet. And did I mention it has a lot of room inside?
customer_reviews.author: C. Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: Great cage
customer_reviews.text: Charlie the chin was given to my daughter in what was basically a hamster cage. We finally purchased this for him. His personality has changed and he is a very happy boy. I did make fleece covers for the trays so he would not nibble the plastic. I was able to put it together on my own. The only confusion was the screws that attach to the top to keep the hooks for the top in place do not tighten so the hooks are pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hill

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is the mansion of all habitats. Only had it for a week and my chinchilla absolutely is in love with this. Instead of running free range, I get the look of, "can I go back to the fun place?" Sturdy, well made, easy to put together. Fantastic size, am able to include a variety of platforms, wheels, dishes, toys. Shipped fast. Absolutely love everything about this. Happiest purchase I have made for my little munchkin. Thank you Midwest Homes for putting your heart and mind into your products for our furry family members. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mumsd@w0rd

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cage!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have zero complaints about this cage. Assembly was easy, nothing was bent or hard to assemble at all. It is super easy to clean the removable trays and ramps. Lots of places to hang and place accessories. The doors are full length and come off completely if needed. My rats have lots of places to run, climb and hide in this very spacious habitat. The storage space is very handy too. My cat even likes to sleep on top and underneath without shaking the cage and bothering my rats. My cage wheels do not lock very well, but i don't really need them to.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Congdon Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great cage for rats.
customer_reviews.text: First off, yes the first one that arrived had a cracked base tray. After a very quick phone call to Amazon customer service they had a new one sent out and the old one was picked up the next day. Now that the new got here it was quick to assemble, about a half hour. It came with a small screw driver but a electric will make life a little easier, although there are only 8 screws. Everything fit together very well and it is quite solid. Plenty of room for the 2 rats in it. The bottom shelf is perfect to store food and bedding. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Some bent parts but overall nice cage
customer_reviews.text: A few of the square corner pieces that the sides slide into were bent and took a little work to straighten out. But I got everything in place and put together. The doors dont line up all that great, just enough to latch. My guinea pig will be just fine, but a rabbit could push them open. Overall its a really nice cage. CONS -bent pieces -some were a bit scratched -doors dont line up PROS -nice size -doors completly open the whole front of the cage for easy cleaning -the cage itself is quite solid -it looks nice
customer_reviews.author: B.OgleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Happy chinchilla mom.
customer_reviews.text: So I was reading the review when I got my cage. I did wonder if it was going to be worth it. It was. My little girl loves the room. Nothing was bent or twisted. It was not as hard to put together as I read. It also came in good time. Took about 5 days. I think it was worth the money
customer_reviews.author: LaToya Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Should have options for metal trays
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my chinchilla. It's very sturdy. Heavyweight. I recommend it mostly. There were a few things that need to be tweaked and it would be perfect. The trays were warped and are plastic so he knaws them, should be a metal option for such an expensive item. I am going to have to spend about$200 on metal trays. The corners had bent posts I had to straighten before it would go together. The directions are vague and pictorial mostly. The doors have locks that don't line up properly and I have to struggle with them a bit to open and shut them. But he took a while but now loves his cage, and it should last years.
customer_reviews.author: Cambray

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Roomy
customer_reviews.text: Once we put this thing together, our little bunny has loved the freedom and roominess it provides. I think the assembly is only downside, it can be a pain. Took about an hour with 2 people, had to get out the hammer to make some things fit. Still I would recommend it, its very easy to clean, and move around. It is large, but we have it in our living room so our little lady can be a part of the family.
customer_reviews.author: RubErDuckee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy high quality cage
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for diamond doves. They are supposed to be docile but were beating the crap out of each other. So we read they need a wider base rather than a tall cage because they do not fly as much. We decided to try this even though it isn't really meant for birds. It was not too difficult to put together and the quality is excellent. The doves are happy, playing with each other and no longer attacking. I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Single Story Deluxe Critter Nation
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the single story critter nation for our 2 guinea pigs. It is easy to clean, and gives enough room for both of them. The only complaint on this product is that the side panels did not fit in the holes. My girls were very frustrated trying to put the cage together... but then after reading reviews I pulled out a hammer and hammered the sides into place. Problem solved. YOU WILL NEED A MALLET OR A HAMMER.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Happy daughter happy critters!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has several rats as pets and this cage fits her needs. You are able to partition it off. She has 2 female and one male rat. This cage has lots of room for toys and large litter pans. Moves from room to room easy .the castor's aka the wheels spin decently. Overall my kid has no complaints and is very content with this cage. This cage would work for other small critters also. I wouldn't put a baby mouse in it they would squeeze out.
customer_reviews.author: Insert name Here!

customer_reviews.title: Great rat cage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a tank and nice for and small to medium sized animal you may have as a pet. Rats ain't getting out and cats are getting in. Doors open to expose entire inside and a slightly cut large sized home Depot cement mixing pan fits nice and gives a good deep bottom. Great purchase for price and would recommend. Remember to look at and measure dimensions. This is bigger than what you think, but small enough to fit in a kid's room.
customer_reviews.author: YOU

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: DO. NOT. HESITATE!!! BUY IT..., if you love yourself to save cleaning time, and if you love your little fur baby(ies). I got this for my piggies, and we all know how messy they can be. Now they have sooo much space, and the cage doors and width will makes it so much easier to interact with them and for cleaning. The cage is almost as tall as me, and I’m 5’8”. I’m so happy and I hope they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Duchesse77

customer_reviews.title: Solid cage for two pet rats
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid, well made cage which we bought for our two pet rats. They have plenty of room to run around and find their own cozy niches. The pans are made of sturdy plastic that is easy to remove and clean once a week. The entire cage can be taken apart easily for deep cleaning or storage. The horizontal cage bars are spaced tightly enough together to accommodate even young rats. The only downsides are the high cost - but well worth every penny, and also it is quite large, so make sure you have enough space for it wherever you plan to put it!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY recommend this excellent habitat!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this animal habitat. My daughter had 2 rats which quickly became 11 rats (one momma was pregnant... oh-oh!), and these rats are totally happy in this giant cage. The panels slide out easily for cleaning and it allows you to either share the cage between the animals or block it off if you want to keep them seperate. Very sturdily built and comes on wheels so you can move it easier to clean it out underneath. This cage would be big enough for ferrets, rabbits, and other larger critters too. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: COMom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sugar gliders
customer_reviews.text: These cages are perfect for sugar gliders. As soon as I set the first up, I ordered another. The only reason I gave one less star is before the second was even delivered, the price dropped $20/Cage. I asked for a price adjustment and was told I would have to return both and reorder. These cages are over 100lbs. With all that’s going on right now it would be nice if price adjustments could be made a little easier. $40 in my opinion is a lot, but not enough to justify trying to return I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Kara C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice cage and the double doors are a plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cage as the one that I had didn't have a way for me to separate food as one of my animals was hogging all the food. What I truly love about this cage is the two layers, the fact that you can separate the food, and the double doors. What I don't like about it is: the fact that my animals have to walk in their own droppings it seems like it is messier than my prior cage the double layers don't allow for hanging long foraging objects I am still happy that I bought this cage though.
customer_reviews.author: Ptamom

customer_reviews.title: Terrible cage
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we've purchased this same cage. The first time, it was incredibly difficult to make the pieces fit together. They're simply not engineered correctly. But we made it work. Not surprisingly, the cage fell apart after less than two years. So, I bought another - not realizing that I bought the exact same cage. That was my mistake. We've been trying to put it together for hours. And yet again, the pieces simply don't fit. We know what we're doing. It's the way the pieces are manufactured, not user error.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty simple to put together. All parts were present and in good shape. Packaging was not damaged, super heavy though! I love the cage. The size is awesome. We have rats and the 1/2" bar spacing is perfect, I dont have to worry about my escape artist. I absolutely love the big doors. Makes setting it up and cleaning up a breeze. Love the storage shelf on the bottom for extra things I have. All around amazing cage!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cage is great, arrived banged up
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like this cage. I've had one before and it was excellent. That said...Cage came with several of the connectors bent beyond belief. 1 was flat... Made assembly much more difficult than it needed to be. I was able to bend them back with pliers, so I won't be returning, but I'm not happy it showed up this way. Also the box was ripped open during shipping and looked pretty banged up (obviously not the seller's fault, but perhaps better packaging would help).
customer_reviews.author: Zyphlat

customer_reviews.title: Ferrets love it!
customer_reviews.text: (The picture I included was right after I set it up and put 2 of my ferrets in it. They have a lot of hammocks and what not in it.) I upgraded my Ferrets cage to this one. I much say I do love this cage! So easy to clean. I have 4 Ferrets that love it. Biggest downfall was the top piece was bent so it was hard to get it to connect with all the side pieces. Also because pieces were bent some it took about 4hrs to put it together. This cage is very sturdy and heavy. Eventually I’ll buy another one to add onto their current cage to make it even bigger.
customer_reviews.author: ASH B.

customer_reviews.title: Tough to put together but high quality
customer_reviews.text: Really high quality cage! My ratties love it, but it was damaged when I received it. Some of the metal was chipped and the bridge was bent. Instructions were not clear and you are going to want a rubber mallet or hammer when putting this thing together. It's not as easy as it says it is and took us awhile. Other than this, the cage is really wonderful! !!Another note for people wanting to use loose substrate!! The pan that comes with this is made for fleece or puppy padding as bedding, don't use loose bedding unless you want a huge mess. A large cement mixing tub works perfectly as a deep dish pan.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Alene Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Third Critter Nation purchase...last Critter Nation purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Critter Nation purchase - two base units and an add-on. This arrived with the washers and screws loose in the box and one screw missing. A few of the pieces were scratched up with the protective finish worn off. At this point I do not see the advantage of paying more for a product that is in such poor condition when it arrives new in the box.
customer_reviews.author: BMuseTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Decent cage....once assembled
customer_reviews.text: Now that it is assembled, this is a good cage. I consider myself someone who can easily put things together, and this was not easy. The biggest problem is that each individual piece is not labeled, so we were left guessing if we had the correct pieces. Additionally, the door piece and both short side pieces had corners that were damaged/bent and required significant messing with in order to get them to work. Lastly, the silver knobs what make up the door latches do not line up properly. Between that and the damaged corners, the take-away feeling is that the cage is shoddy both in design and execution. I hope I can get a few months out of it.
customer_reviews.author: BCL

customer_reviews.title: Great for rats!
customer_reviews.text: Even baby rats stay safely in this mansion of a cage! I have 5 girls living in our cage and they love it! My babies are not yet litter box trained so I’ll have to afix some acrylic to the bottom half to keep them flinging their poop onto my floor, but for the safety and space it’s totally worth the effort. It’s is SUPER easy to assemble. I did it myself with the assistance of a rubber mallet in less than 30 minutes. If you have pet rats and you’re on the fence about which cage to get, GET THIS CAGE! Your rats will be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Childs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rats.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for ratties. Opens up big so easy to clean. Annoying to put together but worth it. Finally a cage advertised for rats that's actually for rats. Rats dont always get enough space but my girls are happy and free in there, they dont even want to escape I can leave them in there with the doors open to clean up a bit and they dont jump out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: phenomenal cage!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cage and our two guinea pigs love it! A word of caution though, this is a very heavy cage, 110lbs. The box was really beat up from shipping and just a couple of cage parts were bent. However, pliers were able to bend them correctly and still remained very strong. This is not a cheap cage, its really heavy duty. This will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J

customer_reviews.title: TWO YEARS AND STILL GREAT! Highly recommend: easy assembly, stable, looks awesome!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: We've had this for two and a half years and it still works great. Our guinea pigs love it and I would highly recommend it. I ordered this after much research. I was prepared for a long day of assembly based on reviews. My thirteen year old son asked if he could start putting the product together and he assembled it, without help, in an hour. The product is stable, looks great and is a perfect home for two guinea pigs. They each have their own level and learned to use the ramp within a few hours. They love to run around as the cage is roomy. I would highly recommend the product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Cage bought for guinea pigs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cage for 2 guinea pigs. I also purchased the tray covers to eliminate the use of bedding. I assembled this cage by myself. The instructions were very clear. It was very easy to assemble and once assembled is very sturdy and well built. Everything fit together just right. My pigs seem to be very happy in this spacious cage and I don't regret that I spent the extra money on this cage. I looked at many cases before purchasing this one. The others did not have great reviews and had listed many problems. This was worth the $ and will give my pets a great space for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Talie Smith

customer_reviews.title: This thing is heavy duty! Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I feel as if this will last me my entire life. My rats love it, it's pretty easy to clean and quite large. It is relatively expensive but it definitely feels like it's expensive and that makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Durable and a breeze to keep clean!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift to my granddaughter who has a 1 1/2 year old dwarf bunny. It is perfect for the rabbit. So easy for her to keep clean! The trays pull out, making the cleaning and sanitizing a snap. The sturdy wire sides endure a hard scrub brushing also. The rabbit enjoys easy movement to the different levels and much more space than what it was living in. The shelving underneath the cage is perfect for holding all the rabbit food and supplies. The lock down wherls are great for keeping the cage still and then easy for a 9 year old girl to unlock and move the cage without assistance to a new area when need be.
customer_reviews.author: Karen DeRoche

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and sturdy cage for rats
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Double Critter Nation cage in 2 months. This one was $20 more and disappointed me. The ramps are now plastic instead of wire, the top panel was bent, as were some of the other hardware pieces. We were able to mostly bend pieces back into shape and get it assembled. 2 of the plastic trays were bent, one with a piece chipped off. The alligment on the door releases was off and a couple were stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Twinning

customer_reviews.title: Two-time cage buyer
customer_reviews.text: Love the MidWest cages! I've owned two of them--the 2 unit cage for my chinchillas, and then I just bought the single unit for a new rabbit. Best bang for your buck. They're well built, last forever, and look nice. No plastic with stupid colors, so they blend in with well decorated homes. If you want the color, you can add it using the ramp covers, bowls, water bottles. Easy to build, however some of the corners can be tricky to get together. A second person to build this helps a lot, and a mallet to pound the corners/pins straight as needed.
customer_reviews.author: LaurindaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT BE USED AS A STAND ALONE
customer_reviews.text: This cage Is THE cage for rats Well built, good welds, good design. Doors that make cleaning easy, and the rats are less likely to get their little bones crunched when trying to close the door Note for the add on: THIS CANNOT BE USED BY ITSELF! THIS UNIT USES PIECES OF ANOTHER CAGE, AND DOES NOT INCLUDE A TOP SECTION AT ALL! Otherwise, no better cage out there.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Inman

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I lIke this cage, but was disappointed in the shape it arrived in. Several of the pieces were bent so badly that I had to use a rubber mallet to pound them straight again. (Though the ramps are purposely bent, so don't pound those straight.) Also the shipping details states the package weight is 33 pounds, however when I opened the door when it was delivered the first thing the UPS driver said was "I think they lied about the weight". It weighs well over 33 pounds (Probably closer to triple). The cage is massive. Larger than I expected, so I was pleasantly surprised. If it had arrived in better shape I would have given five stars.
customer_reviews.author: gibsonlespaul2425

customer_reviews.title: Terrific rat cage!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this cage since 5/17 and it is ideal for our 3 rats. They use both floors and climb up and down the sides (good for exercise.) We added an extra large running wheel mounted to the side, a clip on hammock for sleeping/privacy and provide small cardboard boxes for them to sleep/hide/play in. It's easy to wheel from room to room. I also like how the top floor tray can be rotated to block off hole to the 2 levels for cleaning or introducing new critters to each other without direct contact. Probably best to get the metal side accessories to add-on to the bottom perimeter to avoid bedding scattering onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: The dubble doors make cleaning the cage and playing with your little critter in the cage super easy. Took me about 45min - 1hour to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my pet hedgehog so i kept the ladder up to the second story off and converited that space for his heating lamp. The dubble doors make cleaning the cage and playing with your little critter in the cage super easy. Took me about 45min - 1hour to assemble by myself but if you had a 2nd person to help it would go much faster. Not everything fit together super easy and some things did require force. Once assembled cage is very sturdy and secure. Only 4 stars because of price (wait for it to go on sale).
customer_reviews.author: jessica rae

customer_reviews.title: Our bunny gives it 2 paws up
customer_reviews.text: Well made and looks great. Easy to assemble. We are using it for our dwarf bunny. Although it isn't marketed for a bunny, it works great. I HIGHLY recommend the scatter guards Midwest sells to keep the shavings in the cage (they sell one for both levels).
customer_reviews.author: PriceisrightTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: High quality cage- happy owner happy critters.
customer_reviews.text: I just assembled this cage, but I can tell how much easier it will be to clean and maintain than a cage with smaller doors. It's well built and fairly easy to assemble- a couple steps toward the end needed some persuasion from a soft-faced mallet but nothing was difficult. The large doors make interaction with your critters easy as well. No more door opening and a giant scary hand snatching them out of their homes. I'm attempting to litter train- we'll see how much stuff scatters out of the cage and onto the floor. No cage is perfect, but hopefully they'll take to the litter boxes I installed and keep mess to a reasonable amount.
customer_reviews.author: jwitt

customer_reviews.title: The Taj Mahal of rat cages!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! We upgraded and holey cow! This is huge and I LOVE the double doors for cleaning. My rattie girls love it. Lots of room to run. Was easy to put together and the directions are fantastic. I would suggest 2 people though just because of the weight and trying to balance it to put it together. Took my husband and I about 30 minutes to asseme.
customer_reviews.author: Amie

customer_reviews.title: Huge cage!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected. I’m glad I didn’t get the double-decker. This one is plenty big for two rats. Assembly was a bit difficult as one of the bars on the frame was damaged and bent, so I had trouble fitting the top on. Took some work to get it together, but it’s a nice, sturdy cage. The rats like to chew on the plastic tray, though. I cover the tray with fleece and clip it down, hope that deters them from chewing.
customer_reviews.author: SHouser

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a couple issues...
customer_reviews.text: For 250 dollars I expected a pretty flawless cage. Out of the box one of the plastic covers had a split side,it also had no extra screws or nuts, which you should have just incase one came up missing, unfortunately one of the screws that came with it had a flaw, so I couldn't screw it in easy and definitely probably not as tight as it should be. It was extremely hard to put together, but I managed to do it by myself. It is very spacious, and over all I like it, it's very spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This cage exceeds all of my expectations tenfold. The cage is about 5 and a half feet tall and is incredibly spacious. The way the cage is designed, they don't waste a single inch of playspace. I have two ferrets who are so much happier, healthier, and more well behaved than they ever have been before. I strongly recommend this cage to anyone who has an inkling of consideration. If you think it might work, it definitely will.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy, EASY to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Great, well made product. It was hard to assemble with 1 person. And I'm good at assembling furniture and such. It's a heavy cage so the pieces are big and heavy. My only gripe is that some of the pieces didn't fit well together. Took a LOT of finagling the pieces to make them fit. And the door is uneven in the front. But still functional. A bummer but oh well. Other than that, my rats LOVE the upgrade. Great cage.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Webb

customer_reviews.title: This is really a great cage. We purchased the larger one
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great cage. We purchased the larger one. It wasn't too hard to put together, it is extremely sturdy and is an attractive cage with lots of space. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I wish it had a small hatch door. To open the cage it only has giant doors that make it easy for small pets to escape if you're just trying to feed them or put them back in the cage. The large doors are very convenient for cleaning, but one small door somewhere would be a nice improvement to the design. Otherwise- this cage is the best you can get!!
customer_reviews.author: Alysson Burgos

customer_reviews.title: I recommend over others
customer_reviews.text: Great cage. My only criticism is the quality or lack thereof. The alignment of the doors is off. It’s a lot of money for a cage and I feel the quality could have been better. Having said that I’m happy with it. The one thing I did buy was a tray for the bottom as the one it comes with is cheap and doesn’t hold the bedding in.
customer_reviews.author: gilee

product_meta.title: Midwest Deluxe Critter Nation
product_meta.description: Style:Single StoryThe Critter Nation Single Unit (model 161) by MidWest Homes for Pets provides the ultimate habitat for a variety of small animals including Rats, Chinchillas, Ferrets, Dagus, etc. The single unit Critter Nation creates the spacious living area small animals require to thrive and the 1/2 " horizontal wire spacing allows pets to fulfill their instinct to climb & explore in a secure environment. Each single unit Critter Nation / small animal cage comes equipped with 1 plastic ramp and ramp cover, one resting shelf and one easy to remove base pan for easy cleaning. We included full-width double doors that provide maximum accessibility for easy cleaning and feeding. The wide expansive shelf and full-width plastic pan floor provide a generous play area for your Dagu / Chinchilla / Rat and helps to prevent dangerous falls. Designed with customer convenience in mind, we've included "critter-proof" dual-locking door latches that provide a secure, easy one-handed operation. The shelf includes a removable plastic tray for easy cleaning and is height adjustable so you can tailor the small animal cage to your pet's needs. The Critter Nation has multiple attaching points for adding hammocks, tubes, toys and other accessories that are sold separately. Includes appropriately angled plastic ramp that is specifically designed to ensure pet safety and protect your pet's tiny feet. Constructed from sturdy square tube frame and durable wire metal the Critter Nation has an attractive gray quartz hammer tone finish that is sure to blend with any decor. If you wish to add onto your Critter Nation cage, please take a look at the Critter Nation Add-On Unit (model 163) and be sure to check out our available Critter Nation small animal Accessories to spruce up your Critter Nation as well! MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with a 1 Year Manufacturer's Warranty.
feature_bullets: Includes one pan, one adjustable shelf, one plastic ramp with cover & easily maneuverable stand with 4 locking wheel casters
Full-width double doors on Critter Nation small animal cage and removeable shelf provide maximum accessibility for easy cleaning & feeding
Critter Nation's wide expanse shelves & full width leak-proof pans provide maximized play area & prevent dangerous falls
Great for Rats, Chinchillas, Dagus, Ferrets |Tubing (Corners) 0.6 inches square & 1/2 " horizontal wire spacing allow pets to fulfill their instinct to climb & explore in a secure environment
Dimensions: 36" Length x 24" Width x 39" Height
No tools required assembly & includes a 1- year manufacturer's warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
